prompts: Describe a step-by-step decision procedure for handling a green light when a pedestrian is directly ahead and the vehicle intends to go straight. Include yielding rules, right-of-way logic, and braking thresholds.

Generate a control-policy explanation for an autonomous car at a green light intending to go straight while a pedestrian is crossing the roadway ahead. Specify perception checks, stop/go logic, and safety buffers.
Write rules for a driving controller deciding how to proceed at a green light when a pedestrian obstructs the forward path. Include hazard classification and safe-waiting logic.

Explain how an automated vehicle should handle a green light when moving straight but its forward path is blocked by a pedestrian. Include decision timing, acceleration suppression, and re-evaluation cycles.
Create a formal decision-making model for a green-light scenario where the car wants to go straight but detects a pedestrian in the lane ahead. Include stopping distance considerations.
Describe the high-level behavior policy for a vehicle turning right on green while a pedestrian is present on the right-side crosswalk. Specify right-of-way rules and gap selection.
Outline a step-by-step control procedure for a right turn on green with a pedestrian detected on the right. Include braking, yielding, and decision gating.
Write a set of if-then rules governing right-turn behavior when a pedestrian is present on the right during a green signal.
Define a traffic-ruleâ€“consistent controller policy for turning right on green when a pedestrian is approaching or entering the right crosswalk.
Generate a structured algorithm for approaching a right turn at a green light with pedestrian presence on the right. Include continuous re-check of pedestrian intention.
Describe a behavior controller for left turn on green with a pedestrian detected on the left. Include right-of-way evaluation and safe-turn acceptance.
Write a rule-based decision model for turning left on green when a pedestrian is present on the left crosswalk. List constraints and acceptable actions.
Explain how an autonomous car should resolve conflicting signals when turning left on green but a pedestrian is occupying the left crosswalk.
Provide an ordered list of actions for preparing a left turn on green when a pedestrian is present on the left. Include stop-and-yield conditions.
Generate a left-turn controller description for a green signal with left-side pedestrian activity. Ensure compliance with pedestrian precedence.
Create a detailed decision algorithm for an unprotected left turn (no green arrow) with an oncoming vehicle present. Include gap assessment and yield logic.
Explain how an automated vehicle decides whether to complete an unprotected left turn when an opposite-direction car is present. Include safe-turn thresholds.
Write a step-based left-turn decision policy for unprotected left turns with approaching oncoming traffic. Include speed prediction and conflict zone timing.
Describe a finite-state controller governing unprotected left turns when an oncoming car is approaching the intersection. Include safe-abort logic.
Formulate if-then rules for deciding whether to wait or turn during an unprotected left when a vehicle approaches from the opposite direction.
Describe left-turn decision-making without a left-turn arrow when cars are approaching from the left or right. Include gap-acceptance reasoning.
Write an algorithm for evaluating whether a left turn can be performed when cross-traffic is approaching from either side. Include time-to-collision logic.
Explain a rule-based perception-action loop for unprotected left turns when multi-directional traffic is present.
Generate a left-turn conflict-resolution procedure for evaluating cross-traffic threats during unprotected left-turn maneuvers.
List required checks and safe-turn acceptance conditions for a left turn without a dedicated arrow and with cross-traffic approaching.
Provide a step-by-step left-turn policy when no left-turn arrow is present but the intersection is clear. Include gap confirmation timing.
Describe a model for deciding whether to execute a left turn at an unprotected intersection when no traffic is present. Include rolling-start logic.
Outline a safe-turn controller for unprotected left turns when the environment appears clear. Include re-verification rules.
Define a gap-acceptance reasoning framework for deciding to initiate an unprotected left turn into an empty intersection.
Write a deterministic turn-authorization algorithm for a clear unprotected left-turn scenario (no conflicting agents detected).
Describe behavior for a protected left turn when a green left-turn arrow is active. Include acceleration rules and minimal-risk checks.
Generate a procedural model for executing a protected left turn with a green arrow. Include conflict-zone confirmation steps.
Write stepwise instructions for a left turn under a protected phase ensuring full right-of-way. Include start-motion and exit-zone logic.
Explain how a vehicle should execute a protected left turn safely and efficiently when the green arrow is illuminated.
Create a structured policy defining allowable actions during a protected green-arrow left-turn maneuver.
Write a decision process for performing a right turn on red when no vehicles approach from the left and no pedestrians are on the right. Include complete-stop logic.
Describe rules governing a right turn on red with no conflicting vehicles or pedestrians. Include lawful requirements and timing.
Generate a control routine for right-turn-on-red scenarios where the intersection is fully clear. Include safety-verification loops.
Explain how a self-driving car verifies safety before executing a right turn on red in the absence of conflicts.
List explicit checks required before proceeding with a right turn on red when the path is clear.
Formulate a decision algorithm for blocking conditions preventing a right turn when pedestrians or cars approach from conflicting directions.
Describe how to handle a right-turn attempt when a car from the left or a pedestrian at the right creates a conflict. Include yield and wait states.
Write if-then safety logic for suppressing right-turn execution when conflicting agents are detected.
Outline conflict-resolution behavior for right-turn suppression due to cross-traffic or pedestrian presence.
Explain the perception rules and braking actions for an obstructed right-turn scenario with multiple conflict agents.
Provide a procedure for a stop-sign approach when cross-traffic is present. Include full-stop rules and alternating arrival logic.
Generate a formal model of stop-sign behavior when vehicles are approaching from the left or right. Include gap acceptance.
Write a sequential policy for handling cross-traffic at a stop sign before proceeding straight or turning.
Describe a safe decision-making approach at a stop sign with active cross-traffic requiring yield-before-proceed.
List rule-based constraints for evaluating whether to proceed from a stop sign when cross-traffic is present.
Create a clear-action sequence for a stop sign when no cross-traffic is present. Include stop verification and safe proceed.
Explain the minimal-risk procedure for proceeding through a stop sign when the intersection is empty.
Write deterministic rules for confirming absence of conflict before moving through a stop sign.
Describe motion-restart logic at a stop sign when the intersection is verified clear.
Provide a step-by-step controller for a stop-sign scenario with no detected cross-traffic.
Outline a right-turn decision policy at a stop sign where cars or pedestrians may approach from multiple directions.
Describe a procedural algorithm for deciding right-turn safety at a stop sign with multi-directional hazards.
Write rules for right-turn gap acceptance at a stop sign involving pedestrians and cross-traffic.
Explain safe-turn logic for right turns at a stop sign with possible side threats.
Generate a scenario-based decision-tree for right-turn behaviors at a complex stop-sign intersection.
Explain the required actions at a red light when going straight, including stopping, waiting, and readiness for green.
Write braking and stopping rules for approaching a red light intending to go straight.
Describe the required state transitions for an automated vehicle approaching a red signal while going straight.
Provide a red-light compliance algorithm ensuring full stop and readiness to proceed once legal.
Generate rules for red-light full-stop enforcement and monitoring for signal change.
Describe the decision process for proceeding from a stopped state at a green light. Include reaction time and safe distance checks.
Write restart conditions for a vehicle at a green light after previously stopping. Include pedestrian + vehicle re-check.
Explain how an autonomous car detects and verifies safety before moving from rest at a fresh green signal.
Create a reactivation procedure for forward motion when the vehicle is stopped but the light is green.
List safety conditions required before resuming movement at a green light.
Describe behavior rules for lane keeping and merging when another car is present near the intersection. Include lateral safety margins.
Write a conflict-resolution algorithm for merging near an intersection with a side vehicle present.
Explain how to maintain lane stability when a side vehicle is close during intersection approach.
Generate a formal model for turn-signal and lane-change logic near an intersection with side-vehicle detection.
Provide safe merging rules for intersection-adjacent lane-change scenarios.
Write a decision-making algorithm for handling an uncontrolled intersection with cross-traffic present. Include priority and gap assessment.
Explain how an autonomous car determines entry safety at an uncontrolled intersection with active cross-traffic.
Describe the complete perception-to-motion process for navigating an uncontrolled intersection with multi-directional hazards.
Generate if-then logic for yielding and entering an uncontrolled intersection with cross-traffic.
List rule-based acceptance conditions for entering an uncontrolled intersection safely.
Describe resolution rules for conflicting control signals when both a stop sign and a traffic light are present. Include precedence logic.
Explain how an autonomous car resolves contradictory signals when a stop sign coexists with an active light.
Write deterministic rules defining which control device (light or stop sign) takes priority in conflicting-signal scenarios.
Outline verification steps for determining safe behavior when a stop sign and traffic light appear simultaneously.
Generate a supervisory decision-policy that reconciles conflicting intersection controls under formal traffic-rule logic.
